questions.question_text: Which solution benefits from signal attenuation and provides channel reuse for high-density Wi-Fi deployment in an amphitheater?

An engineer needs a budgetary number for the quantity of 9115AXI APs in a new conference center. The engineer plans to use only the 5 GHz band and use 20 MHz channel width. Based on this requirement and Cisco best practices, what is the amount of square feet covered per AP in a high-density conference room layout?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A typical office environment, Figure 1, may have APs deployed for 2,500 to 5,000 square feet with a signal of -67 decibels in millowatts (dBm) coverage and a maximum of 20 to 30 users per cell. That is a density of one user every 120 square foot (sq. ft.) and yields a minimum signal of -67 dBm.But in high density area the size should be less like 1000

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. Typical office is 2500 square feet, high density is 1000.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/solutions/industries/docs/education/cisco_wlan_design_guide.pdf

questions.question_text:
An engineer is designing a new wireless network for an international company. The design must have these requirements:

• broadcast wireless channels based on country regulations
• controllers to support APs for regulatory domains
• RF changes applied on APs per country that are installed
• multiple-country feature to be used on the controllers

Which design approach must be taken?

choices.D: Create an RF group with controllers configured with the same set of countries in the same order.
choices.A: Install APs and controllers with the same license number across all offices globally.
choices.C: Create an RF group with controllers configured with the same set of countries in the random order.
choices.B: Install APs and controllers with the same part number across all offices globally.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When using the multiple-country feature on a Wireless LAN Controller (WLC), all controllers in the same RF group must have the same set of countries configured in the same order. This ensures that the RF group's broadcast frequency bands, channels, and power levels comply with country-specific regulations.

Selected Answer: C
The key point in this question is that between options C and D, option C is correct, and option D is incorrect.
Both options convey almost the same concept, but the reason for an area being white on the map does not mean there is no RF signal.
The phrase "indicates no RF signal" in option D is what makes it incorrect and eliminates it from the list of correct answers.

Selected Answer: C
Low signal strength. The signal strength is below the cutoff value (-75 dBm) and the visualization is not shown

questions.question_text: After the completion of a site survey with Ekahau Site Survey tool, using the default color palette, it is noted that multiple areas are shown as white on the heat map when viewing 5 GHz signal strength data. What does this indicate about the signal strength?

choices.B: The area is below -100 dBm at coverage cell edge.
choices.A: The area is below -67 dBm at coverage cell edge.
choices.D: The area is below the detectable level and indicates no RF signal.
choices.C: The area is below the minimum threshold configured on the tool.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Alignment points help in precisely lining up the different floors in a multi-story building.

Selected Answer: C
Adding alignment points on each floor helps to accurately measure the signal bleed through between floors. These points ensure that the software understands the vertical alignment between the floors and can properly calculate the signal propagation.

questions.question_text: An engineer must design AP placements for a new branch office that contains two floors. The engineer uses Ekahau to complete the predictive survey. To calculate the signal bleed through between floors, the engineer creates a building, adds the floors, and attenuations areas. After the scale is set, what else must be added on the floors to accurately measure the signal bleed at a specific location?
